tool.name: RNALfold
tool.description: calculates locally stable secondary structures of RNA
tool.command: RNALfold -L $span -T $temperature -d$dangling < $fasta_input | sed -r 's/(^[.()]*) +(\(.*\)) +(.*)/\1\t\2\t\3/' > $out_file #if $varExists('$advancedOptions.noconversion') #if $advancedOptions.noconversion --noconv #end if #if $advancedOptions.gquad --gquad #end if #if $advancedOptions.nolp --noLP #end if #if $advancedOptions.nogu --noGU #end if #if $advancedOptions.noclosinggu --noClosingGU #end if #if $advancedOptions.notetra --noTetra #end if #end if

param.name: span
param.label: base pair span
param.help: Maximal distance between two paired bases. (-L)

param.name: dangling
param.label: how to treat dangling end energies
param.option: unpaired bases participate in all dangling ends (2)
unpaired bases participate in one dangling end only (1)

param.name: noconversion
param.label: no conversion
param.help: --noconv do not convert thymine to uracile (T -> U).

param.name: gquad
param.label: G Quadruplex formation
param.help: -g take into account G Quadruplex formation

param.name: nogu
param.label: No GU pairing
param.help: --noGU don't allow pairing of G and U.

param.name: noclosinggu
param.label: No GU pairing at the ends
param.help: --noClosingGU don't allow pairing of G and U at the ends of helices.

param.name: notetra
param.label: No stabilization for loops, hairpins etc.

tool.help:
**RNALfold**
Compute locally stable RNA secondary structure with a maximal base pair span. For a sequence of length n and a base pair span of L the algorithm uses only O(n+L*L) memory and O(n*L*L) CPU time. *Thus it is practical to "scan" very large genomes for short RNA structures*. Output consists of a list of secondary structure components of size <= L, one entry per line. Each output line contains the predicted local structure its energy in kcal/mol and the starting position of the local structure.
-----
**Input format**
- RNALfold requires one input file in FASTA format
------
**Outputs**
- text output with dot-bracket notation and free energies of the secondary structures
